page.title: 16Keeping in touch
page.content: There is only one public telephone box in Pensilva. Most people have their own telephones. We have estimated that there are about 600 private telephones in our area. People using the postal service can buy their stamps at the Post Office. There are three post boxes in the village. The boxes are emptied each morning and afternoon by a postman coming out from Liskeard. The letters are taken into Liskeard and then to Plymouth where they are sorted for delivery. There is one delivery to houses each day, usually in the mornings. First class letters mostly arrive the day after posting within the district and second class letters take about three days on average. {Jason James Clatworthy. {Daniel Welsh.
